duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide subject matter expertise in regional strategy and policy recommendations related to energy market activities including the real-time energy and day-ahead market operations.
Lead and manage the functional group, directing day-to-day activities, providing guidance, and overseeing project initiatives.
Plan, analyze, design, and support projects enabling continued participation/integration in market initiatives and new market expansion.
Oversee and manage all Balancing Authority Area market tools, as well as procedures utilized in real-time operations.
Act as a SME in the market stakeholder processes and/or other market related initiatives, collaborating with other business units and identifying, analyzing, and resolving real-time issues.
Identify and coordinate changes needed to accommodate market enhancement releases and integration for new real-time energy and day-ahead market entities.
Participate on various advisory committees and task forces, providing input into team employee performance reviews and flagging performance and personnel issues.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor's Degree in Engineering, Business, Economics, or related field; or equivalent combination of education and related experience
